--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bryce Fischer" <bryce@b...> wrote:
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kevin Klinemeier [mailto:zipwow@y...]
> > 
> > Actually, that's a good point I should've caught the first time.
> > Java's serialization framework shouldn't be the thing under test 
> > here.

> This is a good point that I never thought of. I may be misusing JUnit 
> in this case, as I'm merely doing this as a "proof of concept" kind of
>  test. In other words, I'm proving to myself that when I save 
> something, I'm able to retrieve it some time afterwards. The 
> serialized object itself is only going to be saved once, but read from
> the disk many times...

if you are practicing TDD, you need that test(s) to drive you to add
serialization support.. even if it's just the matter of adding
"implements Serializable" (but it's sometimes more than that).

Dave
